title: Exodeoxyribonuclease/DNA repair detector
description: This feature specifically detects exodeoxyribonuclease genes and related DNA repair/recombination machinery in bacterial genomes, particularly gamma-proteobacteria. It shows strong, consistent activation spikes near genes encoding RecB/RecC exodeoxyribonuclease V components, SbcB (exodeoxyribonuclease I), RecJ (single-stranded DNA exonuclease), and other DNA repair enzymes. The feature activates precisely at or near the coding regions of these genes, with highly specific and pronounced activation spikes. The biological function represented is nucleic acid processing and repair, essential for maintaining genome integrity. The pattern is highly consistent across the examples, with strongest representation in Agarivorans albus and other gamma-proteobacterial genomes, suggesting potential taxonomic specificity.
